note.p: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, fr. 9345
Roman de la Rose (ff. 2r-62v), Les Sept articles de la foi (ff. 63r-72r), Le Codicille (ff. 72r-72v), Le Codicille in Latin beginning "Miserere deffunctorum" (ff. 72v-73r)
Gothic, Rose poem written in 3 columns of 62 lines; subsequent texts in 2 columns written by a later hand of the 15th century
Miniatures have been attributed to the Maubeuge Master (this is according to Rouse and Rouse, see bibliography)

83 single-column panel miniatures (mostly on gold grounds) with pink, blue and gold frames patterned in white and outlined in black (ff. 2r (x3), 2v (x4), 3r (x3), 4r (x2), 4v, 5r, 5v (x4), 6r, 6v, 7v (x2), 8r, 9r, 9v, 10r (x2), 10v (x2), 11r, 11v, 12r, 12v, 13v, 14r, 15r, 17r, 17v, 21r, 22r, 23v, 29v (x2), 30v (x2), 31r (x2), 31v (x2), 32r, 32v, 33v, 34r, 35r, 35v, 36r, 36v (x2), 37r (x2), 37v, 38r, 43r (x3), 43v, 44r, 44v, 45r, 45v, 47v, 48r, 48v, 52r, 55v, 56r (x2), 59v, 60r, 60v (x2), 61r (x2).) Foliate bar border incorporating birds, a winged creature, dogs chasing a hare, and a decorated initial on f. 2r. Animals and heads in profile have been drawn as part of the lengthened and decorated ascenders at the tops of columns. Hybrid, partly human creatures are drawn in the lower margins of ff. 11v and 17r. Champie initials follow miniatures; there is a larger initial on f. 13v, to mark where Jean's poem begins. Blue initials flourished in red and red initials flourished in blue throughout.
376 x 260 mm (this measurement is according to Langlois)

French, early 19th century; light brown calf marbled binding with the arms of Napoleon I stamped in the centre of upper and lower covers, raised spine bands, title of the book and initials of Napoleon on spine, marbled endpapers.
Stamps of Bibliotèque Royale; it was formerly ms. anc. supl. fr. 123.
"Riens sans cela" is written on f. 1r and f. 73v.
2. Richard H. and Mary A. Rouse, Manuscripts and their makers: commercial book producers in medieval Paris, 1200-1500 (Turnhout: Harvey Miller, 2000) I, p. 185; II, App. 4F
This description has been compiled using the site's images and various published sources. If you have corrections or additional information on the manuscript, please do contact us.
